comment_data.body: At least of travis indefinite output is usually a sign that something has segfaulted and the test-running hasn't picked it up (so is forever waiting for it to finish). It's always a bit of a pain to diagnose but just be the last test that was started.

comment_data.body:
GitHub Actions doesn't allow to run on other architectures (unless you set up your own runners on those architectures). The way to achieve running on different architectures is through an action that uses docker images to simulate the architecture. This seems to have an effect on the compiling of the tests, causing them to take longer (only a speculation). 

The weird this is that this also happens on macOS when using python 3.8, but not on 2.7 (might be a test dependency slowing it down). I will investigate more on this cause might be the script or something not installed correctly causing it (has happened before I opened this pr)

Any info welcome!

comment_data.body:
> Generally this looks like a good direction. You mention that some of the tests take a /long/ time to run, do they also take a long time on jenkins?

Jenkins is self-hosted, so you would need to set up your own instance for that (something which I haven't done). Also, this would have the same problem with different arch's as GitHub actions, since you would need the phisical hardware to run it on.

comment_data.body:
Looking at your runs, I'm not convinced that the `-j7` argument is being passed (or it's being ignored somehow). I'd expect to see multiple `Ran XXX tests in YYYs` reports.

It was `if [ -z "$TEST_CODE_STYLE" ]` in the old Travis version (although I'm pretty vague on bash, so I don't know if that's for good reason)

@@ -0,0 +1,78 @@
+#!/usr/bin/bash
+
+# Set up compilers
+if [ "${OS_NAME##ubuntu*}" == "" ]; then
+    echo "Installing requirements [apt]"
+    sudo apt-add-repository -y "ppa:ubuntu-toolchain-r/test"
+    sudo apt update -y -q
+    sudo apt install -y -q ccache gdb gcc-8
+    if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then
+        sudo apt install -y -q g++-8
+    fi
+    sudo /usr/sbin/update-ccache-symlinks
+    echo "/usr/lib/ccache" >> $GITHUB_PATH # export ccache to path
+
+    sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/gcc gcc /usr/bin/gcc-8 60 $(if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then echo " --slave /usr/bin/g++ g++ /usr/bin/g++-8"; fi)
+
+    export CC="gcc"
+    if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then
+        sudo update-alternatives --set g++ /usr/bin/g++-8
+        export CXX="g++"
+    fi
+fi
+if [ "${OS_NAME##macos*}" == "" ]; then
+    export CC="clang -Wno-deprecated-declarations"
+    export CXX="clang++ -stdlib=libc++ -Wno-deprecated-declarations"
+fi
+
+# Set up miniconda
+if [ "$STACKLESS" == "true" ]; then
+    echo "Installing stackless python"
+    #conda install --quiet --yes nomkl --file=test-requirements.txt --file=test-requirements-cpython.txt
+    conda config --add channels stackless
+    conda install --quiet --yes stackless || exit 1
+fi
+
+# Log versions in use
+echo "===================="
+echo "|VERSIONS INSTALLED|"
+echo "===================="
+python -c 'import sys; print("Python %s" % (sys.version,))'
+if [ "$CC" ]; then
+    which ${CC%% *}
+    ${CC%% *} --version
+fi
+if [ "$CXX" ]; then
+    which ${CXX%% *}
+    ${CXX%% *} --version
+fi
+echo "===================="
+
+# Install python requirements
+echo "Installing requirements [python]"
+python -m pip install -r test-requirements.txt || exit 1
+if [ "${PYTHON_VERSION##pypy*}" -a "${PYTHON_VERSION##3.[4789]*}" ]; then
+    python -m pip install -r test-requirements-cpython.txt || exit 1
+fi
+
+if [ "$TEST_CODE_STYLE" == "1" ]; then
+    STYLE_ARGS="--no-unit --no-doctest --no-file --no-pyregr --no-examples";
+else
+    STYLE_ARGS="--no-code-style";
+
+    if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then
+        python -m pip install pythran || exit 1
+    fi
+    if [ "$BACKEND" != "cpp" -a -n "${PYTHON_VERSION##2*}" -a -n "${PYTHON_VERSION##pypy*}" -a -n "${PYTHON_VERSION##*3.4}" ];then
+        python -m pip install mypy || exit 1
+    fi
+fi
+
+# Run tests
+if [ "$COVERAGE" != "1" ]; then
+    export CFLAGS="-O2 -ggdb -Wall -Wextra $(python -c 'import sys; print("-fno-strict-aliasing" if sys.version_info[0] == 2 else "")')"
+    python setup.py build_ext -i $(python -c 'import sys; print("-j5" if sys.version_info >= (3,5) else "")') || exit 1
+fi
+
+export CFLAGS="-O0 -ggdb -Wall -Wextra"
+python runtests.py -vv $STYLE_ARGS -x Debugger --backends=$BACKEND $LIMITED_API $EXCLUDE $(if [ "$COVERAGE" == "1" ]; then echo " --coverage"; fi) $(if [ -n "$TEST_CODE_STYLE" ]; then echo " -j7 "; fi) || exit 1

+    ${CXX%% *} --version
+fi
+echo "===================="
+
+# Install python requirements
+echo "Installing requirements [python]"
+python -m pip install -r test-requirements.txt || exit 1
+if [ "${PYTHON_VERSION##pypy*}" -a "${PYTHON_VERSION##3.[4789]*}" ]; then
+    python -m pip install -r test-requirements-cpython.txt || exit 1
+fi
+
+if [ "$TEST_CODE_STYLE" == "1" ]; then
+    STYLE_ARGS="--no-unit --no-doctest --no-file --no-pyregr --no-examples";
+else
+    STYLE_ARGS="--no-code-style";
+
+    if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then
+        python -m pip install pythran || exit 1
+    fi
+    if [ "$BACKEND" != "cpp" -a -n "${PYTHON_VERSION##2*}" -a -n "${PYTHON_VERSION##pypy*}" -a -n "${PYTHON_VERSION##*3.4}" ];then
+        python -m pip install mypy || exit 1
+    fi
+fi
+
+# Run tests
+if [ "$COVERAGE" != "1" ]; then
+    export CFLAGS="-O2 -ggdb -Wall -Wextra $(python -c 'import sys; print("-fno-strict-aliasing" if sys.version_info[0] == 2 else "")')"
+    python setup.py build_ext -i $(python -c 'import sys; print("-j5" if sys.version_info >= (3,5) else "")') || exit 1
+fi
+
+export CFLAGS="-O0 -ggdb -Wall -Wextra"
+python runtests.py -vv $STYLE_ARGS -x Debugger --backends=$BACKEND $LIMITED_API $EXCLUDE $(if [ "$COVERAGE" == "1" ]; then echo " --coverage"; fi) $(if [ -n "$TEST_CODE_STYLE" ]; then echo " -j7 "; fi) || exit 1

+name: CI
+
+on: [push, pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  ci:
+    strategy:
+      # Allows for matrix sub-jobs to fail without canceling the rest
+      fail-fast: false
+
+      # MATRIX:
+      # =======
+      # Required parameters:
+      #  os                  the os to run on
+      #  python-version      the python version to use
+      #  backend             the backend to use
+      #  env                 any additional env variables. Set to '{}' for none
+      # Optional parameters:
+      #  extra_hash          extra hash str to differentiate from other caches with similar name (must always start with '-')
+      matrix:
+        # Tests [amd64]
+        #
+        # FIXME: 'cpp' tests seems to fail due to compilation errors (numpy_pythran_unit)
+        # in all python versions and test failures (builtin_float) in 3.5<
+        os: [ubuntu-18.04]
+        backend: [c, cpp]
+        python-version: [2.7, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9, 3.10-dev]
+        env: [{}]
+
+        include:
+          # Ubuntu sub-jobs:

+          - os: ubuntu-18.04
+            python-version: 3.7
+            backend: "c,cpp"
+            env: { TEST_CODE_STYLE: 1 }
+            extra_hash: "-codestyle"
+          # Limited API
+          - os: ubuntu-18.04
+            python-version: 3.6
+            backend: "c,cpp"
+            env: { LIMITED_API: "--limited-api", EXCLUDE: "--no-file" }
+            extra_hash: "-limited_api"
+          - os: ubuntu-18.04
+            python-version: 3.7
+            backend: "c,cpp"
+            env: { LIMITED_API: "--limited-api", EXCLUDE: "--no-file" }
+            extra_hash: "-limited_api"
+          - os: ubuntu-18.04
+            python-version: 3.8
+            backend: "c,cpp"
+            env: { LIMITED_API: "--limited-api", EXCLUDE: "--no-file" }
+            extra_hash: "-limited_api"
+          # Stackless
+          - os: ubuntu-18.04
+            python-version: 2.7
+            backend: c
+            env: { STACKLESS: true, PY: 2 }
+            extra_hash: "-stackless"
+          - os: ubuntu-18.04
+            python-version: 3.6
+            backend: c
+            env: { STACKLESS: true, PY: 3 }
+            extra_hash: "-stackless"
+          # Pypy

+            python-version: pypy-2.7
+            backend: c
+            env: {}
+          - os: ubuntu-18.04
+            python-version: pypy-3.6

comment_data.body:
Ahh, ok, I was confused by the mention of CPython2. 

I guess the question is if there is really a community of PyPy3.6 users who should be preferred over PyPy3.7 users. It doesn't make sense to spend too many precious CI resources to test two versions of PyPy.

My justification (for @scoder's consideration) goes something like: any consumers of Cython on PyPy are third-party users installing a package that is kind enough to build for them. People who build their own code will use something like cffi instead. So those third-party consumers of other packages may not even know Cython underlies their code. Since the packages they consume are dropping Python3.6, it makes sense to test for what should be the more up-to-date PyPy3.7. PyPy3.7 will also be the only one to fix bugs going forward (until PyPy3.8 is released).

comment_data.body: Let's try to always test against the latest PyPy(3) releases. PyPy fixes issues all the time and their average user probably won't depend on a "system provided PyPy distribution", so supporting anything but the latest is just duplicating their work on our side.

+            python-version: pypy-3.6

+#!/usr/bin/bash
+
+# Set up compilers
+if [ "${OS_NAME##ubuntu*}" == "" ]; then
+    echo "Installing requirements [apt]"
+    sudo apt-add-repository -y "ppa:ubuntu-toolchain-r/test"
+    sudo apt update -y -q
+    sudo apt install -y -q ccache gdb gcc-8
+    if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then
+        sudo apt install -y -q g++-8
+    fi
+    sudo /usr/sbin/update-ccache-symlinks
+    echo "/usr/lib/ccache" >> $GITHUB_PATH # export ccache to path
+
+    sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/gcc gcc /usr/bin/gcc-8 60 $(if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then echo " --slave /usr/bin/g++ g++ /usr/bin/g++-8"; fi)
+
+    export CC="gcc"
+    if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then
+        sudo update-alternatives --set g++ /usr/bin/g++-8
+        export CXX="g++"
+    fi
+fi
+if [ "${OS_NAME##macos*}" == "" ]; then
+    export CC="clang -Wno-deprecated-declarations"
+    export CXX="clang++ -stdlib=libc++ -Wno-deprecated-declarations"
+fi
+
+# Set up miniconda
+if [ "$STACKLESS" == "true" ]; then
+    echo "Installing stackless python"
+    #conda install --quiet --yes nomkl --file=test-requirements.txt --file=test-requirements-cpython.txt
+    conda config --add channels stackless
+    conda install --quiet --yes stackless || exit 1
+fi
+
+# Log versions in use
+echo "===================="
+echo "|VERSIONS INSTALLED|"

+python -c 'import sys; print("Python %s" % (sys.version,))'

+    ${CC%% *} --version

+#!/usr/bin/bash

+  export CC="gcc"
+  if [ -z "${BACKEND##*cpp*}" ]; then

+    export CXX="g++"
+  fi
+fi
+if [ "${OS_NAME##macos*}" == "" ]; then
+  export CC="clang -Wno-deprecated-declarations"
+  export CXX="clang++ -stdlib=libc++ -Wno-deprecated-declarations"
+fi
+
+# Set up miniconda
+if [ "$STACKLESS" == "true" ]; then
+  echo "Installing stackless python"
+  #conda install --quiet --yes nomkl --file=test-requirements.txt --file=test-requirements-cpython.txt
+  conda config --add channels stackless
+  conda install --quiet --yes stackless || exit 1
+fi
+
+# Log versions in use
+echo "===================="
+echo "|VERSIONS INSTALLED|"

+python -c 'import sys; print("Python %s" % (sys.version,))'
+if [ "$CC" ]; then
+  which ${CC%% *}
+  ${CC%% *} --version
+fi
+if [ "$CXX" ]; then
+  which ${CXX%% *}
+  ${CXX%% *} --version
+fi

+

+echo "Installing requirements [python]"
+if [ -z "${PYTHON_VERSION##2.7}" ]; then

+

+

Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
